com.samysadi.acs.utility.factory

Class Factory

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.samysadi.acs.utility.factory.Factory
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CloudProviderFactory, FailuresFactory, SimulatorFactory, TopologyFactory, TraceFactory, UserFactory, VirtualMachineFactory

    public class Factory
extends Object
    This Factory contains methods to create instances of different classes, accordingly to a given configuration.
    Since:
    1.0

      • connectToInternet

        public void connectToInternet(NetworkDevice networkDevice,
                     Class<?> networkInterfaceClass,
                     Class<?> networkLinkClass,
                     Class<?> networkProvisionerClass,
                     long linkUpBw,
                     long linkDownBw,
                     long linkLatency,
                     double linkLossRate)
        Adds a link to the Internet for the given device.

        See this method for more details.

        Parameters:
        networkDevice - the device to add a link to
        networkInterfaceClass -
        networkLinkClass -
        networkProvisionerClass -
        linkUpBw - maximum bandwidth when the given networkDevice sends data to the Internet
        linkDownBw - maximum bandwidth when the given networkDevice receives data from the Internet
        linkLatency - latency of the link between the given networkDevice and the Internet
        linkLossRate - loss rate of the link between the given networkDevice and the Internet

      • disconnectFromInternet

        public static void disconnectFromInternet(NetworkDevice networkDevice)
        Removes all links between the given networkDevice and the Internet.

        After calling this method, the given networkDevice will have no direct access to the Internet through its own network interfaces.

        Parameters:
        networkDevice -

      • isConnectedToInternet

        public static boolean isConnectedToInternet(NetworkDevice networkDevice)
        Returns true if the given networkDevice has at least one direct access to the Internet through one of its own interfaces.
        Parameters:
        networkDevice -
        Returns:
        true if the given networkDevice is connected to the Internet

      • linkDevices

        public NetworkInterface[] linkDevices(NetworkDevice device0,
                             NetworkDevice device1,
                             Class<?> networkInterface0Class,
                             Class<?> networkInterface1Class,
                             Class<?> networkLinkClass,
                             Class<?> networkProvisionerClass,
                             long linkUpBw,
                             long linkDownBw,
                             long linkLatency,
                             double linkLossRate)
        Creates a symmetrical connection (independent upload and download operations) between device0 and device1 and returns an array containing the two created NetworkInterfaces. The first is the interface of device0. And the second is the interface of device1.
        Parameters:
        device0 -
        device1 -
        networkInterface0Class - needs not to be null or an exception is thrown
        networkInterface1Class - needs not to be null or an exception is thrown
        networkLinkClass - if null will use current factory's defaults
        networkProvisionerClass - if null will use current factory's defaults
        linkUpBw - Maximum BW when sending data from device0 to device1
        linkDownBw - Maximum BW when sending data from device1 to device0
        linkLatency -
        linkLossRate -
        Returns:
        an array containing the two created NetworkInterfaces
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if device0 or device1 has no defined parent
